articles.title: Mushroom-shaped superplume of scorching hot rock may be splitting Africa in 2 - Livescience.com
articles.description: Strange, never-before-seen movements in the East Africa Rift Valley appear to be driven by super-heated rock from deep beneath Earth's surface.
articles.content:
The East Africa Rift Valley is a tear in the surface of Earth. (Image credit: mtcurado/Getty Images)
